reasoning: Profound intellectual disability is a specific subtype characterized by IQ <20. Overall intellectual disability prevalence ~1-3% globally (10,000-30,000 per 100k), with severe and profound combined representing ~0.1% of population (1,000 per 100k). Profound specifically accounts for ~2% of ID cases, estimated at ~20 per 100k. Reported as prevalence (chronic lifelong condition) rather than incidence.
source: CDC NCHS Data Brief No. 473 (July 2023); Prevalence of Intellectual Disabilities - NCBI Bookshelf
